description: Composite numbers n such that (n!/n#)-1 is prime, where n# = primorial numbers A034386.
comments: n!/n# is known as n compositorial.Subset of A140293. Prime numbers are excluded since n!/n# = (n-1)!/(n-1)# when n is prime. - _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 28 2013a(31) > 50000. - _Roger Karpin_, Jul 08 2015
author: Paul Jobling (paul.jobling(AT)whitecross.com)
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 21 2001
a(27)-a(28) from Daniel Heuer, ca Aug 2000
